meanings.definition: A person living on income from property or investments.
meanings.sent1: The rentier enjoyed a comfortable life thanks to the money from their investments.
meanings.sent2: The rentier collected rent from their tenants every month.
meanings.sent3: The rentier joked that they were like a human ATM, always dispensing money.
meanings.sent4: In the world of finance, the rentier was seen as a wise tree, bearing fruits of wealth.
meanings.sent5: The image of the rentier lounging by the pool, sipping on a cocktail, symbolized a life of leisure and luxury.

meanings.definition: A person who receives rent as income.
meanings.sent1: The landlord was a rentier who relied on the monthly rent payments for their livelihood.
meanings.sent2: As a rentier, he made sure to maintain the rental properties to attract tenants.
meanings.sent3: The rentier chuckled at the thought of being paid for simply owning a piece of land.
meanings.sent4: The rentier was like a toll booth, collecting rent as people passed through their property.
meanings.sent5: The rentier's bank account grew steadily as the rent checks rolled in each month.
